intro: Cicerbita sonchifolia, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. Its leaves are deeply lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Cicerbita sonchifolia is often considered a weed but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
